question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the code you generate can be executed and displayed. Please help me implement the following requirement using code: create an SVG image of a boxer wearing boxing gloves in a fighting stance.

checklist.title: Is the basic SVG structure properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG element is correctly defined with appropriate viewport dimensions, namespaces, and responsive attributes. The SVG should have proper width, height, and viewBox settings. Deduct 3 points if the SVG lacks proper viewport settings, 4 points if namespaces are missing, and 5 points if responsive design considerations are absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the boxer's body structure anatomically proportionate and in a proper fighting stance?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the boxer's body parts (head, torso, arms, legs) are proportionally correct and positioned in a realistic fighting stance. Key elements include the boxer's center of gravity being slightly forward, one foot ahead of the other, knees slightly bent, and arms raised to protect the face. Deduct 3 points for each significant anatomical disproportion and 5 points if the stance doesn't resemble a realistic boxing position. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the boxing gloves accurately represented?
checklist.description: Check if the boxing gloves are properly drawn with appropriate shape, size, and position. Boxing gloves should be oversized compared to hands, have distinctive wrist sections, and be positioned correctly on the boxer's hands. Deduct 5 points if the gloves are anatomically incorrect, 3 points if they lack detail or dimensionality, and 2 points if the color contrasts poorly with the boxer. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the implementation include appropriate details and shading techniques?
checklist.description: Assess whether the SVG uses appropriate techniques for creating visual depth and details, such as gradients, shadows, highlights, or patterns. Look for shading on muscles, facial features, clothing creases, and glove textures. Deduct 3 points for flat, single-color representations with no depth, 5 points for missing critical details like facial features, and 2 points for inconsistent lighting direction. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code is well-structured, uses proper SVG elements for appropriate purposes (paths for complex shapes, basic shapes where applicable), and avoids unnecessary complexity. Code with strong robustness should be maintainable and efficient in its approach to drawing the boxer. Deduct 5 points for unnecessarily complex path definitions, 3 points for inappropriate element usage, and 2 points for inefficient grouping strategies. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG includes surprise features that enhance the visual experience (e.g., 1. Dynamic animation for the boxer's movement 2. Interactive elements that respond to user input 3. Realistic texture effects beyond basic shapes). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant path definitions that could be simplified or reused 2. Elements unrelated to the boxer or fighting stance 3. Overly complex effects that increase file size without visual benefit. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core visual elements are obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular organization (such as logical grouping of SVG elements), meaningful naming conventions, and code readability. Deduct 5 points if elements lack proper organization or grouping; deduct 5 points if IDs/classes are meaningless or inconsistent; deduct 5 points if the code is heavily minified or obfuscated without a readable version available. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors with appropriate shades) 2) Clean silhouette with clear foreground/background separation 3) Proper use of negative space around the figure. Deduct 3 points for each visually confusing element, 5 points for clashing color combinations, and 5 points for unclear figure outlines. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether any included dynamic effects enhance the visualization: 1) Smooth transitions if animations are included 2) Responsive interaction if interactive elements exist 3) Performance optimization for complex renderings. Deduct 5 points for jerky animations, 3 points for delayed interaction responses, and 5 points for sluggish rendering on standard devices. The full score is 10 points.
